hero.title: Sangyeon Lee — IT Infrastructure & Systems Specialist
hero.subtitle: I design, build, and care for reliable compute infrastructure: from HPC clusters (Slurm, MPI, InfiniBand) to Kubernetes platforms and secure Linux servers. I like turning messy systems into fast, well-documented, and automated ones.

about.title: About
about.body: Junior Computer Science – Information Technology major focused on systems and infrastructure. I’ve worked as an HPC Cluster Technician and Student Information Technician, supporting cluster expansion, job scheduling, and end-user workflows. I document thoroughly and prefer scripts for repeatability.

roles.title: HPC Cluster Technician · UCO
highlights: Administrate university Linux-based supercomputer server architectures and infrastructure.
Implemented Kubernetes cluster to support containerized workloads.
Developed expertise in high-performance computing (HPC) and cluster management.
Configured and maintained Cisco and Mellanox network switches, including InfiniBand connectivity for high-speed data transfer.

roles.title: Student Information Technician · UCO
highlights: Trained new technicians on ticketing systems, Active Directory, device imaging, troubleshooting, and hardware/software support through hands-on projects.
Provided IT hardware maintenance and troubleshooting for university departments.
Diagnosed and resolved issues related to Windows, macOS, and the campus network environment.

roles.title: Field Signal · Ground Operations Command
highlights: Ensured seamless and reliable node connections for military operations.
Maintained communication centers and combat field communication stations.
